name: address
trans: to give attention to or to deal with a matter or problem

name: novel
trans: a printed and bound book that is an extended work of fiction

name: alternative
trans: something that is different, esp. from what is usual; a choice

name: relatively
trans: in comparison to something else

name: latter
trans: the second of two people, things, or groups previously mentioned

name: compulsory
trans: (of something) that must be done; necessary by law or a rule

name: prior
trans: coming before in time, order, or importance

name: widespread
trans: existing or happening in many places or among many people

name: tutor
trans: a teacher paid to work privately with one student or a small group

name: instruction
trans: the act of teaching someone how to do something

name: vast
trans: extremely large

name: majority
trans: more than half of a total number or amount; the larger part of something

name: exceptional
trans: not like most others of the same type; unusual

name: dissatisfied
trans: not pleased with something; feeling that something is not as good as it should be

name: philosophy
trans: the study of the nature of reality and existence, of what it is possible to know, and of right and wrong behavior, or a particular set of beliefs of this type

name: concerned
trans: troubled with feelings of anxiety

name: adequately
trans: satisfactorily; done well

name: mandate
trans: authority to act in a particular way given to a government or a person, esp. as a result of a vote or ruling

name: periodic
trans: happening repeatedly in a fixed pattern

name: obligatory
trans: (of an action) expected, esp. because it is what most people do
